Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Hume
Reviews.Content: I love this Camera!!!!I was somewhat skeptical about buying this due to the lack of reviews. There arent much reviews on a camera unless it's totally famous or new. So I bought it because it was sale for mothers day.I have been using it for about a week now, took it to the zoo. It took excellent pictures, and on top of that the video function is just awesome, it looks like a movie when you're shooting it!The only problem with this is how the price when up like crazy in a day or two. The camera bundle (red) was on sale for 120. Then the next day it was 130 (when I bought it), then the following week, I check it goes up to 220, then 200. Now it's in the 150's. Just keep your eye on it, don't buy if its over 150!I would recommend it to everyone, unless you're a professional, then buy a bigger better camera. I am looking forward to taking this to Europe and Asia this summer :DOh it's touch screen too, thought it was cool when I found out by accident.You probably wanna also buy the class 10 memory card for this camera when taking high resolution pictures due to the lag on lower class. It does come with a 4GB memory card, but use that for a backup.

Reviews.Title: Great everyday Camera!
Reviews.Author: Adam Petrone "Adam"
Reviews.Content: I've been into photography for almost 25 years and have more cameras then I care to admit to. I use a Nikon D5100 and a Canon SX40HS as my higher end cameras but wanted something to just throw around and carry in my messenger bag for daily events. I blog and Facebook and am always shooting pics around town. I had been using a sd700is for the last few years for that purpose but being from 2006 I figured I'de get something more up to date. The A3400is has not let me down, It takes pictures on par with the SX40HS and sometimes can't tell which camera shot what. It's touch screen is easy to use , it's compact and for the money you just can't go wrong. To be honest I just don't have anything I can say that is negative about the A3400IS. Low light, sunny days the photo's are all sharp. It's a great starter camera or just to leave in your bag for that special photo that comes along. I love it and for the 139.00 I paid it's a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Kymberlee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after somehow breaking my old one (oops). I've had it for almost a week now, and I've got to say that it's almost perfect for the casual photographer. I absolutely love the image quality, the various image modes, and the video quality.The one thing that I'm not really liking is how the image color differs from the playback screen to my computer screen. It's definitely not a huge issue, but it took me by surprise when I found out that pictures appear more cool toned on the playback screen than they actually are.Overall, I'm glad that I decided to keep my new camera purchase "in the family." My previous camera was a Canon Powershot SD1000 and this new camera is an excellent comparison.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Jackie Pascoe
Reviews.Content: I needed a pocket camera for point and shoot and this does the trick. I like that you can shoot movies by just pushing the red button, instead of having to twist the dial as on other Canon cameras I've owned. Very simple to operate and the shots are great, even in low light. I haven't explored all the options - mainly because I just want a handy point and shoot. I haven't really used the touchscreen either.I agree that it is not very easy to use the screen in sunlight.

Reviews.Title: "Red Bundle" Digital Camera Bundle
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased as a gift this special "red bundle" of this camera: this "red bundle" includes a nifty black case, the A3400 camera in red, and a 4 GB memory card.Instead I ended up purchasing for her the Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom Lens and Full 1080p HD Video and returning this one.The primary reasons are that we found the Elph 110 HS excels in low light situations if put in 'manual' mode, and the A3400 does not handle low light as well as the Canon Powershot Elph 110 HS. The Elph 110 HS has a maximum 3200 ISO in manual mode, versus the A3400's 1600 ISO. Neither camera will reach their full ISO in automatic mode, according to Canon. In auto mode, the Elph 110 HS will normally stop around 2200 ISO and the A3400 will stop around 1200 ISO, according to Canon.In addition, the Elph 110 HS records video in HD 1080p at 24 fps or 720p at 30 fps, while the A3400 records at 720p at 25 fps.We tried both cameras and compared images and videos from both cameras, and preferred the images/videos taken with the Elph 110 HS. Although the low light images taken in manual mode look a little "pushed" from both cameras, to use a darkroom phrase. I think it's because it is such a high ISO that it is like using a high-speed film and can't look entirely natural.Yet the A3400 does a good job overall; we got bright and pleasing shots with it. So you will get good stills or videos with this camera. Canon makes excellent point-and-shoot cameras so if you choose this one for casual point-and-shoot photography, you won't be disappointed.Both cameras have image stabilization, which means if you have shaky hands, this will make the picture quality look better.This is a great package deal in a camera at a great price. Also, the red is a really nice color. I usually prefer Canon cameras in silver, but the red looks clean, crisp and modern.WHAT'S IN THE BOX (RED BUNDLE ONLY; THE OTHERS ARE ALL ITEMS MINUS THE CASE AND THE MEMORY CARD):* PowerShot A3400 IS* Battery Pack NB-11L* Battery Charger CB-2LD* Wrist Strap* Stylus Pen* USB Interface Cable* CD-ROM* Getting Started Guide* Canon Deluxe Soft Camera Case PSC-2070, Black* 4 GB Class 4 Memory CardWHAT YOU WILL NEED:* If you buy the red bundle, nothing, unless you want a cloth to clean the LCD lens.* A memory card reader or memory slot* If you buy any A3400 camera in any color except for the "red bundle," (which comes with the red camera, case and memory card), you will need a memory card and a case, if you like the protection of a case.WHO SHOULD GET IT:* If you are looking for 720p video* It has 16 MP which produces really crisp images* It has a touch panel LCD that is very convenient* If you'd like to have a bundled camera, case and memory card all-in-one (as of this writing the "red bundle" is the only color choice available in this camera).* If you like to shoot photos in low light, if ISO 1600 is enough for your low light needs.Overall, a great value (depending on if you can purchase it at a sale price), especially the "red bundle" option (red camera, case plus memory card) which is currently being offered. One could also consider the Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom, although the Elph 100 HS has a 4x optical zoom and not a 5x optical zoom like the A3400, and 12.1 MP instead of the 16 MP of the A3400, but the Elph 100 HS does 1080p video and has a 3200 ISO. Good luck in your quest to find the right camera for your needs.~~>> "I want to die peacefully in my sleep, like my grandfather. Not screaming like the passengers in his cab." <<

Reviews.Title: IMPRESSIVE!  BETTER THAN EXPECTED.
Reviews.Author: IFLYDISNEY
Reviews.Content: I have several Canon cameras.  Currently including the T3i SLR and Canon's newer S100 point and shoot high-end.The A3400IS is my first Canon with the new IS mode and the first touch screen.I was stunned at the picture quality and the speed of this small and inexpensive camera.  I did use a high-end SD EXTREME SanDisk card and that of course helped.Details were sometimes as good as my SLR T3i.  Really sharp.  Detailed.  Excellent color and very good light.I just don't have anything I can say that is negative about the A3400IS.I did read a review and comment here about pricing and it is true that this camera is all over the map.  Amazon has the best current price and is a trusted source but keep looking because I've seen it between $129 to $179.  I think Canon realizes the demand and quality exceed the price.As far as a VIEWFINDER; wrong type of camera.  This has a 3-inch LCD screen aft and in very bright sunlight, it's a bit of a struggle but not difficult/impossible.Great camera!

Reviews.Title: NOT RECOMMENDED IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR PICTURE QUALITY
Reviews.Author: vodka_oreo
Reviews.Content: This camera has a nice design and feels good in hand. The touch screen is very easy to use and has several cool preset modes that you can play with. ...And that's about all the good things I can think of for this camera.Picture quality is  a major issue for me. No matter the setting is, it is VERY difficult to produce a sharp image unless you are under a strong, bright sunlight. The pictures all look great on its LCD, but once you see the pictures in their original sizes on the computer, they all tend to be fuzzy around the details. My 6-year-old Canon SD700-IS does way better under the same conditions (although to be fair, SD700 is much heavier though they are about the same size). I don't expect it to create quality shots like a DSLR, but when compare pictures taken with other powershot models that either I owned or my friend owns, this one is a disappointment from Canon.It'll be a fun, stylish, and easy-to-use camera for your children or teenagers, given its touch screen and some of its funky modes such as 'Fisheye' and 'Poster,' but if you are look for picture quality, this will disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera for the price.... But
Reviews.Author: Catherine Tovet
Reviews.Content: The button to take a picture is a bit sensitive! Not really an issue except when you have everyone posing, and press the button halfway down to focus, it takes the picture blurry! I have quite a few shots of random things just because I accidentally hit the button  - by no means are those deal breakers though! This is a great little camera - perfect for vacations where you want something that takes a 'good' photo- these cameras will never compare to the bigger models, but if you want a quality product for a great price, your looking at it.  It also comes with a battery and the charger so you really are getting a great deal!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: My daughter looked forward to getting this camera for her birthday.  It works great, even better than mine.  She learned to use it quickly; very intuitive.  A great camera for the price - a true bargain!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: gdegroot "Love all - Serve all"
Reviews.Content: I use this camera for my every day job, i work in a hotel and i have to get pictures all day about the construction, maintenance and everything happening, this camera wont let you down, it feels solid, the screen is not really touch screen cause it Works only for zoom and change the picture with your fingers, but it is not something to stop you, i use to have a Sony Cybershot and this canon is by far better than that, and cheaper than sony.  If you are looking for a nice, inexpensive, day to day camera, nothing artistic, this camera will be your right choice.

Reviews.Title: Good for grandparents
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandparents who still were using disposable cameras.  They are both inept to technology and love this camera.  The picture quality is good and the user interface is extremely easy.  Being a Nikon guy it I am sorry to say that Canon has this line of product leaps and bounds above the rest.  You could give it to a 4 year old and get great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Davs
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a user friendly camera and this is it. Canon's are known for good quality and this model was right for my budget. I use it several times a week to take product photography for art I sell on Etsy. The photos come out crisp and clear, the coloring is accurate, details and texture come out wonderfully. I love it. Oh, and how can I forget, it captures my busy toddler who won't sit still for a photo very well. :-)

Reviews.Title: Pocket/Purse winner
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Hailey "haileymon"
Reviews.Content: Gave one of these to my wife for Christmas. She was using an old A520 (I think), 5MP, 5X Zoom. Awful screen. But it does have a real optical view finder. I like that. I love her but, bless her heart, she's just not good with technology. I had to force an iPod and a MacBook on her. Although she shows signs of her inner geek, She actually asked for a radar detector. I digress...The criteria were: Very Small, lightweight, reasonable pixel count, good screen. And able to just keep in her purse. For $70 this is it.Is it rugget as the old S600? No. I don't think anything is anymore. (except L glass lenses.) So I was looking at all comers from all major brands. Nikon and SONY have some contenders but, partly due to the fact that I am a confirmed Canon Devoté, This seems to fit the bill perfectly. It is indeed small and light weight, it will fit nicely in a small purse. The zoom is not great, but then again, its a compromise between size and function. The stabilized 5x zoom is just fine for the kind of photography she does, and the 16MP sensor gives us enough detail to play with and enlarge images. As for the touch screen, meh. Its a nice shiny widget but, personally I prefer buttons. It feels awkward (to me) to use the touch screen to shoot. It feels unstable. I want a good two-hand grip and elbows locked in. It feels (to me) that changing the grip and moving the fingers around is not stable. The A3400 has lots of modes and enhancements and filters. They're fun but I want the image captured clean. Then I can futz around in CS6 or Lightroom and add the 'artistic' effects. But ya gotta start with a good image. You can do it with this actual pocket sized camera.The camera will also record video in 720p and uses the proprietary Canon Digic4 processor. Its cheap enough that if it gets crushed in her purse, meh, we'll get another one.Spousal Unit likes it. It lives in her purse. She takes more pictures than when she used that clunky 520. I get brownie points. Maybe I'll go try to cash some in...buy the camera. Good night.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Upton Bailey
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a Canon camera years ago, and I liked it very much. In between I purchased another brand, (that I will not name here, but the name rhymes with icon) - anyway, I found my Canon camera amazing to work with. I easily shot several thousand photos with that original Canon Elph. After a while I had a minor issue with my Canon, and I found their customer service to be among the best in business. They were very professional, and a pleasure to deal with. I also had a major problem with the other brand, and found their customer service to be totally incapable of even responding to my requests for information. As a result of this, and because my experiences with the actualy Canon camera was everything it was touted to be, I decided to stick with Canon products. My original instincts with my Canon were correct, and for that reason, as well as because of the amazing features that came with both cameras, I have decided to stick with Canon products from here on out. My first Canon was less than 4 megapixels, and I loved it. My current Canon, the model listed here, is 16 megapixels and has touch-screen capabilities. I am having a blast exploring all that it can do, and it is alot! I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because the camera is everything it was advertised to be. It is easy to use and pictures/videos turn out great with little effort. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a small camera that is easy to take along, but takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera
Reviews.Author: Bargain Buff "Bargain Buff"
Reviews.Content: Wow!  This is a really nice camera.  I love the touch screen it has.  It has a very nice clear screen to visualize before you take the picture.  I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Photos from an otherwise decent camera
Reviews.Author: Armstrong
Reviews.Content: Although I purchased this camera at a local retailer and not through Amazon, I thought I would share my experience with other Amazon customers who are considering purchasing it here:As much as I would like to say otherwise, the picture quality is TERRIBLE. The main problem is the complete LACK OF SHARPNESS. Every picture comes out BLURRY, all detail is LOST, and there's a noticeable LACK OF CLARITY and crispness around edges, even when using flash. You can tell the pictures are going to be blurry even before you take them just by looking at the already-fuzzy preview in the LCD. The lack of sharpness problem is only exacerbated by the EXTREME GRAININESS. This camera overcompensates for camera shake by using ridiculously high ISO speeds, up to 1600 ISO. The graininess present, especially with indoor and/or dark pictures, is simply appalling. I have seen camera phones take better pictures than this thing. The pictures taken with this camera have the unwanted distinct appearance of an OIL PAINTING. Plus the pictures are consistently OVEREXPOSED and the colors are WASHED OUT, FADED and DULL. Also there is some noticeable VIGNETTING around the corners of images.I have adjusted every setting on this camera in both Auto and Program (P) modes to correct this overall problem, and to no avail. Maybe I just got a dud, but even then the problem would be inconsistent manufacturing, which means you have a 50/50 chance of ending up with one as bad as mine.Putting and keeping the camera in Program (P) mode and reducing the ISO to 100 (or 200 at the most) is basically a requirement if you expect to at least pretend to be happy with the results. Unfortunately there are no provisions for adjusting picture sharpness at all, unlike with some other makes of cameras. It will take some heavy editing on a PC for exposure compensation, contrast/brightness adjustment, saturation increase and color enhancements just to make the pictures useable. And of course, true image quality cannot be accurately assessed except when viewing them on a high-quality PC monitor, as about all camera LCD screens make images look better than they actually do.I took comparison shots with this camera and my 5+ year old Samsung S630 camera, which much to my surprise did a lot better than this camera. The Samsung produces surprisingly clear, crisp, vivid, sharp, detailed images that this camera can't seem to match. Seems strange since this camera is nearly 3x more powerful than the old one.Other complaints: The flash unit looks too small; it's about 1/2 to 1/3 the size of the Samsung's flash unit. As a result, flash-fired shots often look "underpowered". The buttons are too small and too recessed (especially the movie button, although it is convenient). I wish they were more like those on the similar Canon A1300, which are larger and laid out better (and has a seperate viewfinder). The battery/memory card cover can be hard to open.All that said, where this camera seems to do well is in recording movies. Even at 720p, the picture quality is crisp and clear. If only this camera would take still pictures with the same degree of sharpness and clarity, it would be about perfect. The image stabilization for movies works pretty well. And it's nice to start recording just by pressing the dedicated movie button, without having to switch camera recording modes. But please note that all movies, although with HD picture, will be in MONO, NOT stereo.A few other good points about this camera: The design and styling is overall very nice, even in red. It's a nice size, lightweight, and easy to hold. The Touchscreen is actually fun to use and works really well for browsing through images and zooming in and around images. The dedicated movie button is convenient. The included rechargeable battery is decent enough, and seems to last for about a day of average picture taking before having to be recharged.But ultimately it's the image quality that counts, and that's where this camera simply fails.[WHAT'S IN THE BOX]The cameraCanon rechargeable Lithium-Ion batteryBattery chargerWriststrapStylus (for use with Touchscreen)PC interface USB cableGetting Started guideWarranty cardPC CD-ROM containing camera user guide, drivers and photo importing/editing software[WHAT YOU'LL NEED]SD memory card with at least 1GB capacity recommendedCamera case (optional)USB memory card reader or slot (your PC may already have a slot installed)[THE NUMBER ONE BEST THING ABOUT THIS CAMERA]Movie quality[THE NUMBER ONE WORST THING ABOUT THIS CAMERA]The images it takes.BOTTOM LINE, it's a nice little camera, but you're supposed to be enjoying and looking at the images it takes, not the camera itself.[WOULD I RECOMMEND YOU BUY THIS CAMERA?]No.

Reviews.Title: Seemed a bit too cheap for the price.
Reviews.Author: belizeanbuay
Reviews.Content: This camera seemed a bit too cheap for the price. The camera itself was not that great after using it for a week or two I couldn't stand it anymore I had to give it up. I gave it to one of my family members. The pictures were a bit too grainy. seemed like it was a $30 camera. People Don't waste you money.

Reviews.Title: Grainy,poor picture quality.
Reviews.Author: M. Canniff
Reviews.Content: i tried this camera for a few days in movie mode,and still pictures.movies were out and inside in auto mode,as were the stills.all shots were grainy and not very clear in movies,when zoom was tried picture got more out of focus.you have to wait a couple seconds for camera to focus as you half press shoot button ,i mite have got a few out of  many that were good.i am not a camera expert,but i know this is not a good point and shoot for me,or my family.i gave my old H.P.digital to my daughter that still takes great picture and movies,it was smaller than this canon.i have went with panasonic lumix dmc-zs-15,all reviews good on this one,and most all others.i wont recommend this camera.return was easy and painless with amazon,good job!

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The A3400 is a great little camera for family snapshots, party pictures, or trips to Disney World when you don't want to carry a heavy bridge camera or DSLR. Pictures are typical of cameras in this price range: slightly soft and colors are slightly washed out. But the camera is inexpensive, fun, lightweight, easy to use and if you can accept it's limitations, it'll give you lots of fun pictures.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: W. Tobias
Reviews.Content: This is an extensively featured camera for the price.  The touch screen capability is a great addition.  The only thing it lacked compared to a number of other Canan P&S; cameras we've had is the panaramic stitching feature

Reviews.Title: ninja's note
Reviews.Author: Leo R. Casida
Reviews.Content: A small unit and compact. this is good for beginner. it is easy to manipulate and functinal descripttions are built in. The video is also amazing. It is also very handy. You can put it in your shirt pocket and go. The pictures are clear.

Reviews.Title: Make yourself a favor and keep the money in the pocket!
Reviews.Author: Gabriel A.
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is HORRIBLE, my cellphone produces MUCH better pictures!Canon, what's on your mind when releasing something like this on the market??

Reviews.Title: Meh.
Reviews.Author: A. Meijer
Reviews.Content: When our Panasonic Lumix went down in a blaze of glory, I opted for a less-expensive option, and hardly (did not) research the purchase at all. Largely disappointed with this camera.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: N. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I bought it hoping it would be a back up for my Sony cyber shot, It's not !  I'm a very experienced photographer who was hoping for a clean easy to access  camera that would be tough. The workmanship was cheaper than expected from Canon, and controls are more awkward and cute than functional. It was driving me nuts, so I gave it to a total beginner and that worked out for them. I then bought a Fujifilm FinePix as my back up. So far so good. If you have lot's of experience with cameras skip the Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A3400 IS is a great little camera!
Reviews.Author: T. David Zimmermann
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Having always enjoyed my Canon AE-1 film camera for many years, I hoped that Canon would also be offering good digital cameras. Turns out that they know the business, and they know what photographers need. I specifically chose the Power Shot A3400 IS from among the Canon options for its particular features, small size and affordable price. I have not been disappointed by any aspects of this camera.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: patricia vetter
Reviews.Content: The new canon powershot A3400 was easy to use, even for someone who is not into electronics.. It took great video and pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Features
Reviews.Author: DJ SILK
Reviews.Content: At 16MP, this pocket cam is definitely powerful and delivers excellent quality pix. My 4 yr old is truly fascinated with the touch screen among other things and has fantasies of HIS camera being a great buy and suggested that I should get my own!!! Go Figure.....LoL

Reviews.Title: great pics
Reviews.Author: Olivia Burten
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pics but we miss the viewfinder.Very lightweight and reliable. Worth what we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Joanne C. Reimer
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera purchase and I look forward to taking it with me on vacation.  The pictures are vivid and it is easy to use.  I'm not a photographer my any means but my pictures sure look like I know what I'm doing.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot.
Reviews.Author: Nana In Florida
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement for a Nikon that I had that got stolen. I paid way more for the Nikon, and this is a much better camera. I haven't even used all the features on this camera, but so far I love the camera, it takes great pictures and is so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: Katherine Holzle
Reviews.Content: Still think about this.  Has some problems with shutter speed.  Liked my old Canon better. Don't know why they don't keep some of the good old features of previous cameras...

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price, but nclued battery lasted for just one charge.
Reviews.Author: CarlBudaTx
Reviews.Content: I purchased it as a Christmas present for my wife who wanted a small "point and shoot" camera. This is my first experience with rechargable cameras (I use SLRs and range finders). It's photos are pretty much what I expected from a camera in this price range, more than adejute for the 4x6 prints my wife prefers. However, the included rechargable battery could only be charge for the first time.  I have tried reinstalling the battery serveral time and charging for a day, but I keep getting the same message "change battery pack". So I guess my next option is to buy a new battery, but I must admitment I am concerned that will not solve the problem because the first battery was new from the factory.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: AFish
Reviews.Content: exactly what I was looking for, I love the size, look, zoom, and price.  I really have not used it in various lighting.  I am not crazy however with the flash everyone has red eyes, so I have to turn the flash off.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: T. Salvador "Torie Lynn"
Reviews.Content: This camera is much better than my last one - very sharp photos.  Good photos at night too!  Just very impressed with it and got it for great price!  Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot A3400 IS 16 MP
Reviews.Author: Debbie Klingeisen
Reviews.Content: Love the camera.  Unfortunately not the brightest when it comes to technology so struggling a bit in learning how to use it effectively.  Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: An excellent product!
Reviews.Author: jsonp9
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this product for my Mom, who needed a new camera. Needless to say, she was very pleased with the product. It arrived sooner than expected, thanks to my Amazon Prime trial. Navigating through the camera's settings wasn't too difficult. I really liked the new touch screen LCD option. In general, I'd say it was a very good purchase!

Reviews.Title: decent
Reviews.Author: GB
Reviews.Content: this is a decent camera good for point and shoot. Not so big on taking quick photos due to lag between pics.

Reviews.Title: Its ok
Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: I didn't realise it had those touch screen features though, It is an upgrade from my last canon camera though

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Waleed Mohammed
Reviews.Content: Price is okay, however actually quality is middling. Focus in low light is hit or miss. Takes some getting used to holding because of small flash unit where your hand usually holds. Small camera, lots of features, just not as sharp as previous cameras.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Santosh Maganti
Reviews.Content: Took this with the thanks giving sale  and very disapointed with the qualityit says 16 MP but the quality grainier and Looks cheap ...very disappointed, i love canon Point and shoot cams but this time they got it wrong .. must have gone with a samsung or nikon PNS..

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A3400 IS
Reviews.Author: p_squared
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Canon digital camera I have owned, having upgraded every 5 years or so.  I find the build quality to be excellent, along with their service and support.  Canon also engineers excellent software for both picture organization and photo sharpening/correction.  They provide timely upgrades to both their drivers and software.  This model delivers great bang for the buck and is easy to use while still providing many options for those who wish to go deeper into tweaking.  I purchased this camera as a Father's Day present.  My 70yr. old Dad enjoys buying and selling on Ebay.  Now he can provde his potential buyers with top notch photos, or video if he choses.

Reviews.Title: Blurry, unusable photos
Reviews.Author: Scott Jernigan
Reviews.Content: I've had several Canon cameras over the years, including several in the small and Elph size models, and I can say with no reservations that the A3400 is the worst camera I've ever used. The JPEG compression or the filtering to overcome it makes every photo of a person blurry or soft. I shot photos indoors and outdoors and have essentially 100 useless photos. The photos are crisp enough when you're not snapping people, but what's the point of a small point-and-shoot when you can't take a quick snapshot of family or friends at a party? I've lowered the resolution from 16 MP to 8 and to 2 (the only options) and people are still fuzzy. So disappointed with this camera, I'm simply dropping it into the trash. No one should suffer through pictures this bad.

Reviews.Title: It works good for the price it was.
Reviews.Author: ELIZABETH
Reviews.Content: It does not bring the memory with it, that is something it has to have. Its an extra cost for the customer.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Anima
Reviews.Content: Just got the camera. Was easy enough to use straight out of the box.  Good value. Will learn more about the camera the longer I use it.

Reviews.Title: replacement for identical camera
Reviews.Author: Isabelle and Maizy "ferrets"
Reviews.Content: Grandma is 85 now and finally switched from 35mm to this model of digital camera.  She liked this camera because it was easy to operate.  She didn't want anything fancy.  "Just the basics, that's all I need". She had this same model a little over a year when I think it got dropped with the lens out and it broke.  When you turned it on, it would shut off right away.  So we were happy to find the identical model to replace grandma's camera so she wouldn't have to learn to operate a different camera. Hopefully this one will last longer.

Reviews.Title: Little Red Camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly Wood
Reviews.Content: Have not had the camera very long but so far I really like it .Very handy to carry in a purse .Will be great for travelling.

Reviews.Title: outstanding
Reviews.Author: manojshah
Reviews.Content: Usingthis type of camerafor over 4 years and very happy as it has a stabilizer and clear pics and can take pic without flash off

Reviews.Title: I love Canons
Reviews.Author: Sista Mini B
Reviews.Content: I replaces my old Canon with this new PowerShot. I think I like it but I don't love it yet.  Maybe I will. It has an ease is use especially the video button. Although the video will not appear to be clear when you zoom in. The pictures are not as sharp as I would think  16MP should be. It's hard to change the settings to what might be appropriate and the touch screen could be a little intrusive while in use.  I kept trying to find a setting to take a full moon and couldn't....blurry every time. I tried to find one that would work with the sun behind me....dark face every time unless I used the flash close up. Then you couldn't see the background. Hard taking some sunsets with me in it. I'm trying to learn more as I go.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap camera.
Reviews.Author: Big time Disney fan.
Reviews.Content: I got this as a replacement for a Nikon L24 which was rubbish. This is much better built, has better quality photos. It's not great in low light but for the money it's a nice little camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CANON
Reviews.Author: gif
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA...EASY TO USE....GREAT FOR MY EBAY BUSINESS....TAKES NICE PICTURES AND IT WAS A SUPER GOOD PRICE FOR THE PRODUCT

Reviews.Title: compact but takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: Victoria M.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer, but I do like my pictures to be good quality. This is a nice small camera that also takes good quality photos, and it has worked well for me.

Reviews.Title: First Camera Separate from Phone
Reviews.Author: Mikala Frank
Reviews.Content: I am not someone who has much experience with digital cameras and photography. I simply wanted a point and shoot camera that would take clear, crisp pictures without requiring much from me, and this camera does the job wonderfully. If you are not a picky photographer but want a camera with excellent auto settings, decent zoom, and a good price, the A3400 IS is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: Mericafkyeah
Reviews.Content: I took this with me when I did some traveling in Africa.  In the Sahara in a sandstorm the lens got kind of messed up but probably just because the sand gets everywhere, I'm still scraping it out of me in the shower....but it served me well for most normal conditions.  for the price I don't think you will find a better camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera. Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Gina Erickson "taken"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. In fact, I love it so much that I told my mom and my brother about it and, after looking at the pics I took with it, they both purchased the exact same one! It's so easy to use and the pictures come out beautifully. Love that there's so many settings to use on it, but if you're technologically challenged (like my mom) you can just set it on Auto and it does a great job. I've had Canon cameras my whole life and every single one has been good to me and lasted a long time.

Reviews.Title: Really good
Reviews.Author: Jahci
Reviews.Content: Loved it, it was a fine camera. Not perfect or anything, but I'm a kid and was traveling so I didn't want to carry around an SLR. It got stolen, though...this time I think I might get an SLR, but really did like this little compact one. The pics were pretty clear and zoomed up nicely. Really good price and quality.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: JED
Reviews.Content: The camera is small and I can carry it in my pocket when I don't want to carry my larger one.  This camera takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Dennis R. Smith, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I used the camera for a about two weeks then I returned it. I never used a touch screen on a camera before and I really do not have to use one again. The pictures were typical Canon quality (above average), it was portable but, I attempted to download and edit the images I took and I found the program confusing. Also, the video software is not compatible with windows. I owned a Canon compact camera before and was very pleased with it but I was just not happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Kolton
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best cameras I have ever bought (and I have bought a lot of cameras all of which cost a bit more than this one. The battery life is really good though it does take a proprietary battery unfortunately. The image quality is great and it still has most of the settings customizable despite being a point and shoot. Where this camera really shines though is the video recording oddly enough. The color and contrast is fantastic and still works well in low light situations. The frame rate is smooth and the clarity is great. even the audio is good but the biggest features with the video is the macro and stabilization. The recordings are silky smooth even with a shaky hand and the details that it can record with macro is out of this world. The touch screen isn't that great but I don't really have any use for it as the menus are just as easy to navigate with the buttons. the feel of it in the hand is very comfortable and feels very solid though I still wouldn't dare to drop it. It even supports up to a 32 gig SD card (maybe more but the largest I have is a 32) What it all comes down to is if it were to ever break or get lost/stolen I wouldn't hesitate to buy another.

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Kratz
Reviews.Content: I like this item very much. I admit, I'm still becoming familiar with the features of the camera, but am very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Very good quality fotos in a small package
Reviews.Author: MCP
Reviews.Content: This small camera takes much better fotos than I was expecting.  We bought it for our young daughter but I use it too when I want something small.

Reviews.Title: Nice gift
Reviews.Author: T Nona
Reviews.Content: A very nice gift for my niece for her HS grad.  She loves it n been taking pictures of her family including Maroon, d sweet dog , taking pics of her pals n places. She said d camera is easy to use n d pics are crisp n clear

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Kettner
Reviews.Content: Nice little handy camera... I've gotten spoiled with my full size though.  Honestly for the majority of my "daily" picture taking purposes, this works fine... when I am going to go out and really try to shoot some bigger shots (buildings, monuments, large groups) I'll still break out the big guns, but again, considering the price, design and intended use... I'll definately keep it.  It is a little slow with the flash to bang... or button push to picture I guess I should say, but again, it's not designed to compete with an SLR.

Reviews.Title: A really nice little camera !!!
Reviews.Author: Alexia César
Reviews.Content: Takes wonderful photos and nice videos too! It's not exactly the most performant, but still really good for the prize !

Reviews.Title: Canan Power Shot Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: A great camera- small easy to carry size and takes very clear pictures.  I love the ability to zoom in both to shoot the picture and then to zoom in more to focus on one part of picture-  the enlargements this way are very clear.  The dating on each picture is not distracting and is great to show when the picture was taken--who can remember exactly??? and  who wants to have to write the date on each snapshot??  I highly recommend this camera--I carry it in my purse for just that time I need it and it is very handy.

Reviews.Title: Wife's camera
Reviews.Author: Daryl Wayne
Reviews.Content: She seems to like it overall. I got it so she could take relatively close pictures of the various things she bakes. It came in very handy on vacation,  though it won't shoot too well through a window of a moving car. It does take being dropped fairly well, as we unfortunately but happily discovered. The menu selections and operation seem to be pretty decent also and this has been a very well-received and highly functional gift thus far. Not especially high end, but not a crapfest, either.

Reviews.Title: beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: molico "booklover"
Reviews.Content: EAsy to use, beautiful pictures. I love it. Instructions are loaded in the machine. I really like products that are hassle free and give good results, much more than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Ccarol
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, gets very good pictures, and is perfect for a user like me who doesn't want to learn photography.

Reviews.Title: Good Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: sluijs01 "sluijs01"
Reviews.Content: Works well for what I need, and I don't expect it to take professional photographs.  Good amount of features.  The touch screen is nice, but I don't feel it adds that much to the camera.  It can be helpful when wanting to not press on the top, you can tap the screen to take a picture, but this can also lead it a different direction of force that you need to stabalize for.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Carla Assis Lacorte
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something a little thinner, but when I started using this camera I loved it!The photos's quality is great! The touch screen is cool too.The only thing I didn't like about it was the noisy zoom button. Specially when you are recording a video you can easily hear the noise of the button when pressing it. Besides the noisy button, I loved it!

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Dakota
Reviews.Content: I just can't manage controls this small and touchy.  The battery retainer lever failed the second week I had it.  I consigned it to the trash.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME DIGITAL CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Rufino
Reviews.Content: I bought this digital camera as a gift for my friend who lives in Europe. He loved it and he regularly sends me high quality photos taken with this digital camera. I highly recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera for an amateur
Reviews.Author: Sunny
Reviews.Content: This is so compact, easy to carry, and relatively easy to learn to use. If you are not a perfectionist about the quality of your photography, this is more than adequate for anyone. Teens and college students would enjoy capturing memories with this camera, as well as adults.  It doesn't come with a lot of instructions, so some people feeling more "technology challenged" will find it helpful to ask a friend or go to a Best Buy store for a demonstration.

Reviews.Title: Canon to the world
Reviews.Author: J A
Reviews.Content: best camera that a low budget can buy, time and time again canon has done iti purchased an 8mp 5 yrs ago and decided to stick with this brand, so i purchased this camera for a femal as a birthday gift.the only thing i cud see they improving is the response time with the touchscreen

Reviews.Title: It really takes good pix
Reviews.Author: Ortodontic
Reviews.Content: I like to take pix but don't have time enough for carring my G 15 or the Nikon so I bought this little one for my pocket: its lovable.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: loumagoo46
Reviews.Content: very nice buy for price takes very good pics and not hard to use I would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! It is so much smaller and easier to manage than our Canon EOS Rebel XTI with a big lens (which also takes awesome pics, but is a huge thing to carry around on vacation when everyone else in the family asks you to carry everything they may/may not need in your purse)! =) Very happy with this purchase. No problems with the seller, shipment or anything else. I'll recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Michael "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera guy. I just want something that will take a good picture when I push the button. This works for what I want. The pictures are clear and crisp and the battery lasts fairly long. But battery life will depend on usage.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Pro-gun
Reviews.Content: Love that it has a touch screen that allows you not only to scroll through images on the camera, but also allows you to snap a picture just by tapping the touch screen.  Battery life is good too using the special battery provided with it.

Reviews.Title: I'm excited to learn photography from this great little camera
Reviews.Author: Rosetta E Tucker
Reviews.Content: I love my Canon PowerShot A3400 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image a lot. I haven't had a long time to really see all that it can do yet, but I will have fun practicing using it. I have never really owned a decent camera and for the money I spent for it, it takes great pictures and videos. I used it at a concert, and ended up with a few videos and great pictures and I hadn't even read the manual yet. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who is new to photography as a great first camera. It has a lot of features that you can use that are automatic helping out a beginner.

Reviews.Title: What a camera!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Friedle
Reviews.Content: I am not a techy person and this camera is perfect for me! All I need to do is aim and shoot, the camera pretty much does everything for me! Just what I need. It also makes movies and videos. I love being able to see exactly what you are shooting on the screen. It even does macro!I haven't even begun to try out all the different features. It is small and lightweight in size, but big in features!I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who is not a professional, but who loves to take pictures and just have fun with photography and not take themselves too seriously! LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me & my uses!
Reviews.Author: JennFrancis "Jennifer McAlpine"
Reviews.Content: I needed a digital camera w/video for my granddaughter and just other daily memories and read a-lot of reviews and seemed to like this one. i like the name on it Canon pretty trusted name. It came pretty darn quickly and it didn't take 24hrs to charge the battery, it only took like an hour and half, which was an awesome surprise, because she was visiting that day.It takes clear crisp pictures and video is easy to turn on w/a button on back. I haven't discovered all this camera has to offer yet, but I like what i see so far. It's a great price and easy to use. i would recommend it for anybody, but i am not a proffessional, but don't see why it can't be a great back up or glovey compartment ready camera!

Reviews.Title: Great small camera...
Reviews.Author: Safety Guy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to take out of country on a trip.  It was small and compact but took great quality pictures.  Its not a SLR model obviously, but takes pretty fast photos of good quality.  She returned with some great shots and we're no photographers.The other option I like on this is the screen on the back is touchscreen.  Makes navigating menus easier and you can even take pictures by tapping the screen (much like a smartphone which is what we were used to).The battery life is outstanding, lasted her whole two week trip with moderate use.  It uses a rechargeable battery (not standard double AA ones though) so you have to take its charger with you but its small too and charges the battery pretty quickly.This was a great choice for a point and shoot camera for vacations and travel.

Reviews.Title: Just What I Wanted!
Reviews.Author: Jean Linhardt
Reviews.Content: Great size for purse, big view screen for seeing pictures, easy to operate --- just a nice Camera! Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed....
Reviews.Author: Angelique Woods
Reviews.Content: It doesn't suck, but I would look for a different camera. It's a touch screen, but other than that it functions like a dinosaur.

Reviews.Title: Big Mistake
Reviews.Author: cop reader
Reviews.Content: The quality of the photos with this camera is pretty bad.  Even worse, there are a couple of dozen icons on the view finder that have no legend in the manual.  I have no idea what they are, nor what they mean.  Pick something else.  This one stinks.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: mj
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and is easy to use! The size is perfect and I can't be happier!  I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Jamie long
Reviews.Content: I loved it! Great camera and I would recommend to people who need to take easy shots! Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: CCOX1971
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent for the price it is selling for. I brought this camera as a replacement for my Sony camera that died after 5 years, and I have not found any complaints to date.

Reviews.Title: Prompt shipping! Gerat Camera
Reviews.Author: Judy A. Novak
Reviews.Content: I finally stopped swimming against the current and went digital.  It was hard giving up on using my Canon AE1 35 mm film camera and about 3500 dollars worth of lenses.  I purchased this camera for the same price as I would spend on 2 rolls of Kodachrome asa 25 and its development.  Plus no worries about the fogging of my pictures going through airport and ship securities. However I am still trying to learn all it does and how to do it but it has been great so far.  I would urge any of my Luddite friends to give this pocket sized camera a chance.  Oh and I do not have to turn off the lights while showing my  "captive" audiences my travel adventures and can prod those falling asleep.

Reviews.Title: Bought Two
Reviews.Author: C. Murray
Reviews.Content: I bought a black one for my dad.  Loved it so much that I bought a red one for myself.  Takes great pics.  My friend is going to purchase one as well.  For under $100 you can't beat  this camera!  The only thing I can complain about is that I can't see the screen in the sunlight.  It doesn't have a view finder that  I could look through.  But that is my ONLY complaint.

Reviews.Title: Easy and Fun
Reviews.Author: Rachel Kovaciny
Reviews.Content: I love my A3400!  It's lightweight yet durable, small enough to fit in my pocket, and has a really big viewing screen!  I've had other Canon cameras before, which made using the different buttons and options really easy.  I also like that you can turn off the touchscreen option.  I really love playing with some of the different picture effects, like the "toy camera" and the "super vivid" effects, and the "discreet" function is awesome for taking pictures during church ceremonies or other places where you don't want a flash or any camera noises.The only thing I don't like is that, unlike my last Canon digital camera, I can no longer select a bunch of pictures and delete them all at once.  I can only either delete them one at a time or all at once.  A minor quibble, however.

Reviews.Title: A little complicated.
Reviews.Author: patsbrat
Reviews.Content: A bit complicated but does the job.  Do not like the touch screen to take pictures.  Something you have to get use to.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Max Weeks
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife around Christmas and she loves it. It takes really crisp pictures and has really good quality for a point-and-shoot type camera. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who doesn't require a high end camera but still wants nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Chia Lao
Reviews.Content: The camera is very nice and easy to use. If you just want a regular camera than this camera is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Birthday Present for my mom
Reviews.Author: Diane Browne
Reviews.Content: She seems to like it.  Lots of options for her to learn.  Big screen to view. We both loved the color.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Drakula "Born2Die"
Reviews.Content: 100% Great Camera , Power Shot A 3400 is excellent , Very quality pictures and camera have a very good design , easy for use and make a high quality pictures day/night and in my case I m in desert so it's have a lot of dust in air, and Flash in day time don't catch dust on picture during the taking ,the picture is clean, Night time is visible and u can see it , but without flash still u can take good picture during low visibility. Zoom is great even during shaking the camera .I recommend this camera to any professional level.

Reviews.Title: CANON IS THE BEST
Reviews.Author: rammer
Reviews.Content: This camera is my second Canon the first one I handed over to my aunt because I purchased a Nikon . Okay w/o hurting any feelings or sales I was more proud of my novice picture taking with the Canon name brand. This camera offers picture stabilization so if you are like me and have shaky hands it will turn out a good and perfect pic everytime.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Nicole Fusco
Reviews.Content: This camera was the best investment. I bought it for a trip to Las Vegas and couldn't be more satisfied. Unfortunately, I accidentally  left my battery charger at home and the camera still lasted my whole trip. I was able to take hundreds of pictures of Vegas and the Hoover Dam etc. I loved playing around with and using all of the different settings. This is the best point and shoot camera I have ever owned!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A3400IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Darlene M. Bayne
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera that takes good clear pictures and it is great to stick in your pocket and go.  I am looking for a better camera hopefully in the next few months.  Right now this is fine.  Good colors and nice sharp images.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!  It is everything and then some!!!
Reviews.Author: Sheri C  Parmann
Reviews.Content: This camera  is light, user friendly, amazingly versatile and very affordable!!  It replaced a Nikon Coolpix (much older discontinued model)  This camera  cost way less and does way more!!  Pictures are great, downloading easy  and I can't say enough about it!  Only downside..did not come with memory card and the instructions were not clear as to  the best one for  it!!!  Love the rechargeable battery too!!  This is a great find!!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShotA3400
Reviews.Author: L. Benoit
Reviews.Content: Ordered this without really knowing anything about digital cameras but it turned out to be a good buy as it is easy to use and the screen is big enough to see.  Plus the pictures on the screen are really clear.  So far I have only taken pictures and downloaded them to my computer (a little tricky).  Takes movies but haven't tried that yet.  Really like this camera.

Reviews.Title: nice price, nice performance
Reviews.Author: Kai Yang
Reviews.Content: it has a nice balance between price and performance, very portable and easy to use and easy to bring everywhere

Reviews.Title: Good, for the price
Reviews.Author: Ricasami
Reviews.Content: Pros:- easy to use- touch screen- sleek design- high megapixel- decent low light- Price- Zoom capacityCons:- shutter lag- touch screen (when activated, i kept pressing it by accident so it kept taking pictures by accident...I quickly turned it back off)- Zooming in drastically lowers picture quality--lot of noiseI use this camera mainly when I go out at night for more functionality over a phone camera, great for quick pictures in pretty good quality. I use my dSLR for better photos. Call it my beater camera; if I drop it I won't be too worried about the loss

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: MeMeof4
Reviews.Content: little smaller than it looked on site - but it is a good camera and takes good shots - very versatile.

Reviews.Title: Touch screen is great--Easily started using without reading manual.
Reviews.Author: IamAPrimeUser-AMA
Reviews.Content: After years of using 5,10 and 14 megapixel (MP) cameras, the clarity and image density of 16mp was astounding! I tapped the screen on the image I took, and kept tapping, and it kept zooming in! The plan is to use it for mostly out-doors photos, but I took 300 photos in a set to archive a botanical display of native and invasive plants and the camera knew when I wanted text-macro mode and when I needed regular macro for plant detail. I've always been impressed with my friends' Canon picture quality and now I get to experience it for myself!

Reviews.Title: PICTURESS
Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: This is a great daily use camera! I finally figured out how to use all the functions, so I like it even better! I am no where near a photographer, but this camera is great if you just want to document your travels. :)

Reviews.Title: GREAAAAAT
Reviews.Author: Jose Gregorio Concepcion Brito
Reviews.Content: I love this cam, i am photographer... This cam is awesome, the pictures sooo fantastic. Sorry my english i from Venezuela jejejeje.

Reviews.Title: Typical Canon Excellence
Reviews.Author: Ken Hofmeister
Reviews.Content: Great price, great product, high quality images and fits in shirt pocket. I have a Canon T1i for more specialized shots, but this is easy to carry and I am much more likely to catch the moment shots with this product.

Reviews.Title: Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: Marc C. Searl "neckwrecker"
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera for work.  Once I put it to use, I was pleased with the quality of pictures for the price

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am still learning all of what the camera can do, but I am satisfied with it so far.the only thing is the battery could last longer for me but then I did take about an hour of video.

Reviews.Title: SO COOL
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It is great and easy to use. I love how it has its own help files so I don't have to constantly read the guide. It takes great pictures and it's easy to carry. I just love this thing.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD SMALL CAMERA .
Reviews.Author: Arturo Benavides
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA HAVE A LOT OF FEATURES AND CAPABILITIES. IT HAS A TOUCH SCREEN, TAKES SHORT VIDEOS, IS COMPACT IN SIZE, HAS A LITHIUM RECHARGABLE BATTERY AND IS VERY RELIABLE.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful shots
Reviews.Author: Dennis Brown
Reviews.Content: Only used this playing around so far but pics are resilient.When you power down the shutter closes up so nothing is exposed to the elements.I bought the 16gb mem card to go with it in case hd video is mandated...LOL.Also very easy to learn to use.I didn't try any effects or anything,just basic use,but learned it pretty much by scanning it over once.

Reviews.Title: Does the job. But not good on quality.
Reviews.Author: Grace G
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera because the Fujix20 isn't available in the UK yet! And I needed a camera ASAP, since I'm studying abroad and all. This camera does the job. With awesome sunlight you have great pictures. Love the wide angle lens on this camera. The only thing that I dislike about this is the annoying touch screen. I mean, it is a great feature, but it gets bothersome. The menu/setting screen is very easy to maneuver. Easy to set up.---- Update 6/17/2013I am now giving this 3/5. Why? The quality of the pictures from the camera to the computer sucks. At first I was at awe at the quality just by looking at the camera screen, but on the computer... wow. What happened? A bit disappointing Canon, I expected something a bit better from you.Stay away if you're looking for quality. Stay farrr away.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: DJ-Dizzy
Reviews.Content: Received this in just one day with standard shipping. Best price on line. Wish it would have come with a SD card so i ordered a 64G card off Amazon for a good price. And it works just fine in my A4000 & my A3400 Canon Power Shot.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Saiyu
Reviews.Content: My other camera compared to this camera; one could tell the difference. It's not like my other was bad either though; but the audio was getting choppy. Which is why I bought this Canon camera instead. I like it, things look "grainy" on the screen when you're recording or what-not, but when you put it onto the computer, it comes out very nice looking. I've not really messed with it much so far; so I guess I can't really say much except that I do like it. Especially from the price I got this at; WAY cheaper than it would have been from Walmart even, so I was happy about saving money here as well.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: cagomea
Reviews.Content: This is the camera I have ever owned! So easy to use. the also so that should make it a breeze. The pictures I have taken so far have all come out very clear. Not like my last camera that I paid double for that hardly ever workEd the way I wanted it to.

Reviews.Title: canon a3400is
Reviews.Author: patricia gough
Reviews.Content: love this camera, very easy to use and takes great pics, l loved the fact that you got a guide and online service

Reviews.Title: Cano Powershot camera
Reviews.Author: CaboChic
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience as I was in Mexico and had to have my camera shipped to a stateside address then forwarded to me.  Everything turned out well and I love my new camera.  It does all and more than I expected for a very resonable price.  Thanks to everyones effort, my experience was very positive.

Reviews.Title: nice!
Reviews.Author: xiaoting wu
Reviews.Content: it is so fast and it is so nice,this camera take the picture so clear,i like it! it is so cheap !!

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Pennstater2005
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to take pictures mostly outside and in good lighting in general this camera will serve you just fine.  I purchased it hoping for some decent low light performance especially since it boasted a nice bright f2.8 aperture.  That's where the camera just would not perform.  I had two lamps on in the living room and took a few shots with both coming out very dark and grainy.  Only slightly better with the flash.  Another area where I was disappointed was the overall build quality.  It is mostly plastic and the screen itself feels cheap like it won't last long.  Overall for a point and shoot under $100 it will be fine for most people but if you are purchasing this expecting good low light photography you should move on.  I ended up returning this and purchasing the Pansonic Lumix DMC SZ7 for 75.00 refurbished.  Much faster autofocusing, better low light performance although still not great(what do you expect for a point and shoot?), and the build quality is much better than this Canon.  To each his/her own though.

Reviews.Title: Good one
Reviews.Author: KumaR
Reviews.Content: 16 MP digital camera with li-ion battery for $70. Its fantastic, and the compatibility and the picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Easy camera to use
Reviews.Author: Rosemaree
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera, love the size only problem is that when you take a picture it is pixlesized. but it comes out on the computer when your downloading.

Reviews.Title: My Sony Ericsson Phone takes better pictures.
Reviews.Author: Victor W. Carrion R.
Reviews.Content: The camera looks and feels nice. I bought it to take pictures of a cruise trip with my wife, but ended up using my Phone to take more than half of the pictures due to the lower "than what I am use to" quality of the pictures. 16mp camera vs 8mp Phone camera... My phone beat it every time.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price & I love Canon products.
Reviews.Author: Ardis D. Geiseman
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the simplicity of using this camera.  It's easy to hold and the setting are easy to change.  The bronze color makes it easy to locate, when I lay it down, at gathering of friends or family.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Matthew Sievert
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice point and shoot camera.  The touch screen is great for reviewing photos.  This is replacing my canon A570is.  It is slimmer, higher Mega Pixel, and has a rechargeable battery.  Excellent.

Reviews.Title: This is a great little camera
Reviews.Author: Dolores E Stefan
Reviews.Content: Still learning the different functions, but the setup and and auto mode is easy to learn and easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: ronchilders01
Reviews.Content: I use this at work as an auto appraiser. Camera is durable and takes great photos. I have used cannon cameras in the past but this one I enjoy the most. Good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Comprado desde España - Excelente elección
Reviews.Author: CedricPuchalski
Reviews.Content: He comprado este cámara desde España y ha sido una muy buena elección.El precio con respecto al mismo producto en España es muy inferior.

Reviews.Title: great camara
Reviews.Author: martha enzensperger-brooder
Reviews.Content: I was going on a trip and needed a camera fast.  So I bought this one. came in the mail in 2 days. I love it. easy to use.  has a toy camera and fish lens that is fun to use.  it take good photos.

Reviews.Title: Great if you can get it for a good price.
Reviews.Author: Customer in South Carolina
Reviews.Content: What I was looking for in a camera for day to day use. It has fairly basic features and the picture quality is about average. The camera is a good buy for under a $100. If you are looking for stunning images and lots of built in camera effects, then look at models higher up than this.

Reviews.Title: Descent For The Money Lots Of Features
Reviews.Author: EmilyCathryn
Reviews.Content: Very very light weight camera! And very small compared to me sony cybershot. But it takes some pretty awesome pictures you just need to know what kind of lighting to take the pictures at on which setting. Takes some getting used to but overall a descent camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Turtle57
Reviews.Content: This was a good choice in the size of the camera but also it's capability.  It takes great pictures and have been using it pretty frequently.

Reviews.Title: Wow, what a surprise
Reviews.Author: Marcella
Reviews.Content: I though I always read reviews on electronics before buying them. But I must have forgotten on this one. A superb camera, a toy with muscle.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, Good Price
Reviews.Author: Mallorie Corinne "Future Mrs. Fig"
Reviews.Content: I am a photographer, and when my sister in law said she wanted a camera and was going to buy a fujifilm I almost had a heart attack. I wanted to get her something that was good but userfriendly. So after research I chose this and it works beautifully. The only reason I gave it 4 starts was because it didnt come with a memory card and that was kind of ridiculous. My rebel came with a few memory cards so this little point and shoot should have had one.

Reviews.Title: Poor photos
Reviews.Author: JRW
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on the excellent reviews. Unfortunately, I was unable to take a sharp picture.  Perhaps it was defective as I have noticed others have had the same problem. The Canon A3400 has been returned and i'm now researching other brands.

Reviews.Title: Loving MY New Canon
Reviews.Author: Gary A. Kramer
Reviews.Content: Going to Vancouver ,Ca and an Alaskan Cruise this summer so I want a new light weight easy travel camera.This will do fine. I haven't used very much but just enough to know we will enjoy.I put a 32 G high Speed SD card in the camera and it should store about 8000 pictures. That should do us.

Reviews.Title: great purchase
Reviews.Author: kate Brucker
Reviews.Content: I like it cause it is small to carry in your purse and easy to handle/  The pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: nothing amazing
Reviews.Author: rudi
Reviews.Content: i was a bit disappointed by the A3400's image performance. I took the same shots with 3 cameras and hoped the canon would top the others. sadly, this camera performed below standard. it may be ideal for beginners, but not for me, and while the images were not horrible, i expected better from Canon

Reviews.Title: One of the best camera ive ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Amanda Scholl
Reviews.Content: Ive gone through well over 10 cameras. Mostly Nikons, Some kodaks. This was the first Canon ive ever bought, mainly because of the price. and ill probably never go back to another kind if i have to get another camera. Stands RIGHT behind my Nikon d3000.. Would recommend to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: good pocket camera
Reviews.Author: lz
Reviews.Content: This camera is tiny, so it fits easily in pockets or bags to take with me. I'm not 100% satisfied with its auto setting, but once I played around with the functions, I found a setting that was good for me. We went to an aquarium and the camera wasn't shooting well (couldn't decide where to use flash or not) but on the dim light setting the pictures came out well

Reviews.Title: No comments
Reviews.Author: alfredo
Reviews.Content: is an excellent camera that complements all my expectations, I am delighted with the purchase of this camera. recomiento 100%

Reviews.Title: Terrible indoor/low-light pictures!
Reviews.Author: A. Rabiee "Rabi"
Reviews.Content: I am not a pro photographer but I've taken pictures with more than 20 point-and-shoot digital cameras since 2000 so I know how to work with a digital camera and also know what to expect from each camera. Having fancy touch-screen functionality is a good feature that this camera has but before that a user expects a fair picture quality from the camera. This camera's picture quality in low to medium light conditions would be 5 in the 0 to 100 scale! even my old iPhone 1st generation could take better pictures than this camera. I did not give it one star because taking pictures outdoor and the overall functionality is OK.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera.
Reviews.Author: Mom Superior "Mom Superior"
Reviews.Content: I like the size for keeping in my pocket. Much easier to use than my old Canon! Easy set up!

Reviews.Title: Great everyday camera
Reviews.Author: Carrie S
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a replacement when my last Kodak broke. Was able to get a better price by almost $80 vs a big box store. Pics are great and upload easily. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera.
Reviews.Author: D. Barnhill
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It makes great pictures. Much better than I expected. Beautiful photos outdoors and even great photos in low light. Some of the photos taken with this camera look as good as with my Powershot SX-40. Very compact and appears very well made.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a great compact camera.  I bought four of these for my daughters to have a decent carry around camera.  This one has many good features that are not inclueded in the description and has an easy to use and intuitive interface.  Acts a lot like I-phone but much better photos.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: review from pa
Reviews.Content: I got this little camera for my husband because sometimes we want to take photos without thinking about changing lenses or carrying extra weight-- we own another camera from Cannon-- and it has been a wonderful experience and surprise for the price: beautiful colorful pictures that only cannon can deliver. I thought the zooming feature would be a problem and so far so good. For its price it is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Canon PS A3400
Reviews.Author: Billie Chaney
Reviews.Content: Great small camera, easy to use, takes great pics. love the battery recharge.LIght weight, Would recommend.I purchased the red one.

Reviews.Title: cool
Reviews.Author: Angelo Valentino
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a small gift for my wife, she loves it. Does what it can do well, so cool!

Reviews.Title: cannon power shot A3400 IS 16 mega pixels
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera a lot. It is small, compact and not heavy and bulky.  The picture quality is great.  I am still learning more about the camera but I still like the camera and I am pleased with the features I know so far.

Reviews.Title: Great  Camera
Reviews.Author: Margaret L. Eberhardt "Peggie"
Reviews.Content: My old digital camera used batteries that kept going dead/  This one last's long and is easy to use and view

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality for Price
Reviews.Author: Hansini
Reviews.Content: Great, light-weight camera that met my expectations for the low price. Beautiful colors and clear pictures. However, it did not have the Foliage mode I loved on a previous Canon point-and-shoot I used.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera for beginning photographer!
Reviews.Author: jose enrique bustos
Reviews.Content: nice pics from this camera and fine videos in hd 720, I love this camera! I recommend you 16gb or more in memory card!

Reviews.Title: Good pictures slow response time
Reviews.Author: L. Bunch
Reviews.Content: This was to replace a Fuji quickshot camera that took too long between shots. This camera is only a little better. Pay more for a camera that won't miss that special shot.

Reviews.Title: good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Shannon Mooney
Reviews.Content: My brother's first digital camera since he has not entered the smart phone age. nice and small to fit in a pocket but takes great pictures and videos

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Shirley Nelson
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera and is user friendly.  It takes good quality pictures.  It is a very good camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy and good pics
Reviews.Author: John Kim
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, less items to choose from the setup menu. The HD video is 720 and it looks great. The sound is good too.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for everyday needs!
Reviews.Author: Daniel J. Kamlah
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for people who enjoy photography as a hobby, or need something for everyday moments.  It is easy to use, a good size, and enough features for the everyday person.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot, just a tad on the slow side.
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Ford
Reviews.Content: Hey Amazon,I bought this point and shoot for my girlfriend after reading a few reviews and deciding it was a good combination of point and shoot and image control (plus I have a thing for Canon's image quality). My girlfriend can grab and get that shot, but she can also compose and create that shot when she wants to do that too. Only thing that bothers me is the touch shutter seems a tad on the slow side, but the button is more intuitive and will see soo much more use anyway.RegardsJonathan

Reviews.Title: Good camera in some ways
Reviews.Author: ChrisThomerson "Capt.Chris"
Reviews.Content: Very handy small and decent features. Sometimes fails to focus for first picture. May be better to put the money towards an iPod or upgrade to your iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: cnjf428
Reviews.Content: My aunt bought me this camera for Christmas because of the great reviews it received, however I have been disappointed in the quality of the images.  I called Canon to see if I needed to change the settings, which I didn't & the girl I spoke to recommended the Canon Elph 110.  I will be returning the A3400 & getting the Elph 110 instead.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A3400
Reviews.Author: Albert Villamar
Reviews.Content: Is a gift to my grandson who enjoyed this very much.It can take video and still shots and it is compact in size.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the price
Reviews.Author: ThreeSidedOrchid "ThreeSidedOrchid"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera yesterday, so I haven't had a ton of time to play with it.That said; I took a few test shots and played with the buttons, so here's my initial impressions.caveat: I'm not a professional photographer. In fact, I bought this camera because I wanted to replace an old 5mp canon powershot, which technically worked fine, but, not having any kind of image stabilization, meant my photos always came out blurry. I wouldn't have bothered with a new one if the reviews here hadn't been decent and the price super-cheap for a 16mp from a trusted company.Pros:--The picture quality, to my non-professional eye, is pretty darn good. Colors are real-to-life but vibrant, auto settings seem to work well indoors with relatively dim light.--Image stabilization is GREAT. Per my notes above, this was a vital feature for me; my hands shake slightly, without image stabilization, I can't take a picture that doesn't have some level of blur. I've managed to snap about 20 pictures on this one, most of them without even bothering to try and hold the camera particularly steady, and they came out clear.--Touch screen: this wasn't a factor in my selection, so it was a surprise to me that i immediately started using the touchscreen more than the buttons - it was responsive, and the icons are mostly large enough to select easily, even with big fingers.Cons:-- the body and charger feel cheap. My previous camera, from nearly 10 years ago, is all-metal in the body, feels solid and good quality; of course, it was a $400 camera at the time, and I picked this one up for $95 after tax, so I wouldn't necessarily expect them to be the same quality. It was just a bit surprising to see the shiny, pretty front, then pick it up and find out the back was a kind of ugly brown plastic.Overall, for the features you're getting, and the current sale price, I think you'd be hard-pressed to find a better deal. This seems, so far, like a great camera for the casual user who wants to be able to take nice pictures. Especially if you, like me, only take photos once or twice a year, and really don't want to invest a lot of money in a camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled by the low price...Highly Recommend!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was the second camera I bought...the first was a more expensive Samsung ST200F which I promptly returned because the interface was so clunky - it took way to long to get through the menu and options.  This camera got consistently good reviews so I figured I'd try it, but didn't expect much based on the price.  I LOVE it!!Far exceeding my expectations, this cheap little camera takes excellent pictures, has a touch screen to get through the menu quickly, even in shooting mode, and has a lot of fun features.  I have shot almost all my Christmas pictures in "toy camera mode" which softly blackens the edges and gives a warm nostalgic feel to any photo.  Close up shots are crystal clear in most lights, the zoom is decent, but not amazing.  The stabilization is excellent even on no-flash settings, which I use most and I have very shaky camera hands.My only real complaint is the dinky noise it makes when you use the zoom.
